content:
Diagnosis:	Gastric adenocarcinoma, initially cT3N2M0, now ypT0N1M0

Management:		Completed perioperative chemotherapy FLOT regimen and total gastrectomy

Histology:	Complete pathological response in primary tumor (ypT0), 2/15 nodes positive. HER2 negative, MSI-high

Current Situation:	End of treatment review

I reviewed [redacted name] following completion of adjuvant FLOT chemotherapy. The final cycle was completed on 15/4/24 with good tolerance. No significant toxicities during the last cycle. Performance status remains 0. Weight has stabilized at 72kg with good nutritional intake following dietetic support. Post-operative recovery has been excellent with return to normal activities.

On examination today, surgical wounds are well healed. No concerning clinical findings. Latest bloods show stable parameters with hemoglobin 12.1 and normal LFTs.

We have discussed surveillance strategy. Given the excellent pathological response and MSI-high status, prognosis is favorable. Plan for 3-monthly clinical review with 6-monthly CT scans for the first 2 years. First surveillance CT arranged for July 2024. Patient understands to contact us if any new symptoms develop in the interim.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: adenocarcinoma with complete pathological response in primary tumor

cancer_timeline.value: Complete pathological response in primary tumor (ypT0), 2/15 nodes positive
Completed final cycle of adjuvant FLOT chemotherapy

patient_facts.value: Return to normal activities following surgery
Surgical wounds well healed, no concerning clinical findings
Stable blood parameters with hemoglobin 12.1 and normal LFTs

status_updates.value: Gastric cancer with excellent response to perioperative chemotherapy and surgery. Complete pathological response in primary tumor with favorable MSI-high status
Complete pathological response to neoadjuvant therapy
Completed adjuvant FLOT chemotherapy with good tolerance
3-monthly clinical review with 6-monthly CT scans for first 2 years
